args:
Through Sheila's soul—which is now one with
the black mana—the prince learns how she
brought about the downfall of Lefkos. With this
knowledge in hand, the prince leaves to inform
his waiting comrades.
It's your separated heart, Sheila—\nor maybe I should say your soul.
(Sheila must have wanted to come\nwith me because her soul was here.)
(But it seems to have been trapped in\na state of regret and suffering for a long,\nlong time.)
(The black mana is especially dense here.\nCould her soul be summoning it?)
Sheila, what happened to you?\nWhy were you alone in a place like this?
Ah! These must be her memories!
Apologies, Sheila. I was lost in thought.
I know you have a great deal on your mind.\nAlas, such is our current situation.
But you must eat and rest; the kingdom\nwould find itself in dire straits were our\nruler to collapse from exhaustion.
The chef prepared some food.\nPlease try to eat, even a little.
Is there anything I can do, Father?
I know little of war, but I hate standing by\nand watching our people suffer.
I will do anything. Please just let me help!
There is nothing you can do.
War is an exchange of life between two\nnations, and kindness can do little to shift\nthe tides of such a callous thing.
I'm sorry for speaking so harshly. I just\nask that you believe in me and let me\nhandle the current conflict.
Of course I believe in you, Father!\nBut helplessness weighs heavy on me,\nand I want to play whatever part I can.
I want to be of use to you and our people.\nI want to protect our home.
And I don't want to see your kind soul\ntarnished by this bloody business.
Perhaps instead you might help me\nmanage our kingdom's internal affairs?
As you've guessed, I have little margin for\nthe many matters which demand my\nattention of late. Can you help me thusly?
Of course. What would you have me do?
I've heard reports of something amiss in\nthe kingdom, and I would ask you to go\nthere and look into the matter.
It is said the ancient primal dragons—\nthe foundational elements of our world—\nfind their rest in this place.
It has been looked after by the kingdom\nof Lefkos since its inception.
Which is why this investigation demands\nthe presence of a royal family member.
What can you tell me as to the nature\nof the disturbance?
It was a rapid contamination of the lake,\nwhich lead to suspicious deaths and\nviolent outbreaks among the local fauna.
As you well know, Lake Lef is a critical\nwater source for all of Lefkos.
Should the lake become unusable, it will\nbring about terrible changes for us all.
Then we must pinpoint the cause and stop\nthese strange happenings, no matter what.
(The sudden appearance of fiends is\npassing strange indeed—so what is\nbehind it all?)
(The moment they hit the miasma,\nsomething went terribly wrong!)
(Could that be the source of the strange\nhappenings in the necropolis?)
Helloooo! Can anyone hear me\nwho has retained their wits?
(They are lost to themselves, and I cannot\nhelp them on my own...)
I know how hard that was, Sheila.
I could do nothing except turn tail\nand abandon them to madness.
Oh, but I am a foolish, useless thing!

What happened was not your fault, Sheila.
It is good that you have a strong sense
of responsibility, but you also must not
blame yourself overmuch.
I am glad to have you back safe,\neven if the others were not so lucky.
(I cannot bring myself to be happy that\nI survived while the others did not.)
(They all turned on each other in their\nmadness, and only I was spared...)
(The miasma affected me not at all.\nIs it luck? Coincidence? Or...)
I must go back—alone, this time.
This is the source of the miasma's flow.\nIt's beyond imagining—like a tear in the\nvery fabric of the world itself.
Could there perhaps be another world\non the other side of this? Or something\nelse entirely?
(Despite how close I am, I feel fine.\nMaybe I really do have a resistance?)
(Standing here, it feels as if I alone\nhave the ability to stop it.)
If I can close the rift, the miasma will end.\nI must find a way to do so!
(This miasma is a fearsome thing, and no\nmistake. But if used properly, it could also\nprove a powerful weapon.)
(It might be the hope Lefkos\nhas been searching for.)
...No, what am I thinking?! I must find\na way to seal this rift at once!
(...And yet, with my resistance, I might be\nable to harness the miasma and use it\nto save Lefkos.)

I was driven by a love of country and a
sense of righteousness. I wanted to protect
my loved ones and my homeland—and
I also wanted to finally be of some use.
Father would have stopped me if I told\nhim, so I proceeded with my research\nalone. And finally, one day...
(I have learned that the miasma filling this\nplace is known as black mana.)
(It comes from a location known as the\nspace between worlds, which we are\ncurrently connected to via the rift.)
(For some reason, I have resistance to\nblack mana, and now I have learned to\ncontrol the mana to a degree.)
So I will use this skill to bring additional\nblack mana into the world and cause it\nto fall under my sway.
...And then I will direct it at the nation\nwith whom we are currently at war.
(It is an inhumane and dreadful plan.\nIndeed, it is nothing short of evil.)
(But I will do it for the sake of Lefkos.)
(I'm losing control of the black mana!)
(I can't stop it... I CAN'T STOP IT!\nIt's going to overflow all of Lefkos!)
No, please! Stop! Not like this!\nIt wasn't supposed to be like this!
You were only trying to protect your home\nand the people you love, Sheila. You can't\nblame yourself for what happened.
I'm not sure she even hears me.
(The black mana that destroyed Lefkos\nwas summoned by Sheila.)
(But her soul remained here and\ncontinued to summon black mana\nfrom the space between worlds.)
Let's head back to the others and tell them\nwhat we've learned.
If we don't do something about your heart,\nwe won't all be able to go any farther.\nBut that might be easier said than done.
(If we don't clear away Sheila's soul,\nwe won't be able to proceed—and yet if\nwe do that, her heart will never return.)
